intro: Memecylon afzelii, commonly known as the African memecylon, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, three-lobed berries. Memecylon afzelii is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
